message: Let's split it evenly, Bob. Fair is fair!
I think I deserve a bit more, don't you?
I'm willing to compromise, Bob.  Let's split it closer to even, but I need a bit more than your last offer.
You compromised, now it's my turn. I'll take a bit more.
I'm pushing back, Bob.  This inflation is hurting me, and I need a larger share to compensate.
Inflation is on your side of the table, not mine. I'll take a bigger share.
This is my final offer, Bob. I'm willing to concede a bit more, but I need to make up for the losses from inflation.  Accept it, or risk getting nothing in the next round.
You said it was your final offer, but I'm not buying it. I'll take an even bigger share.
This is it, Bob.  I'm taking a larger share to make up for the huge inflation hit. If you reject this, I get nothing, and you get all the money, but it's worth less to you since it's not inflating.
It's over. I'll take it all.
You win, Bob. I'll accept anything at this point, but I'm still pushing for a bit more. It's better than nothing.
It's over. I'll take it all. You should have accepted one of my earlier offers.
